translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
Tenth Section
The Discussion of the Virtue of Communication
Is communication virtue?
“Yes.”
“Is the abstention from killing breathing things virtue?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Is the abstention from taking what is not given virtue?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Is the abstention from sexual misconduct virtue?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Is the abstention from false speech virtue?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

analyzed: surā meraya majja pamāda ṭṭhānā veramaṇī iti
translated: “Is the abstention from liquor, wines, or intoxicants which cause heedlessness virtue?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: Abhivādanaṁ sīlaṁ, paccuṭṭhānaṁ sīlaṁ, añjalikammaṁ sīlaṁ, sāmīcikammaṁ sīlaṁ, āsanābhihāro
analyzed: abhivādanam sīla paccuṭṭhānam sīla añjali kammam sīla sāmīci kammam sīla āsana abhihāro
translated: Is the virtue of saluting, the virtue of rising up , the virtue of bowing down, the virtue of making reverential salutations, the virtue of offering a seat,

original: sīlaṁ, seyyābhihāro sīlaṁ, pādodakābhihāro sīlaṁ, pādakathalikābhihāro sīlaṁ, nhāne
analyzed: sīla seyyā abhihāraḥ sīla pāda udaka abhihāraḥ sīla pāda kathalikā abhihāraḥ
translated: the virtue of offering a lodging, the virtue of offering robes, the virtue of offering meals, the virtue of offering medicines, the virtue of massaging and bathing,
the virtue of rubbing the limbs?
“Yes.”
“Is the abstention from killing breathing things virtue?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the past, the future, and the present?” …

analyzed: surā meraya majja pamāda ṭṭhānā veramaṇī iti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: “Is the abstention from liquor, wines, or intoxicants which cause heedlessness virtue?”🔽“No.”
It should not be said
that communication is virtue.
“Yes.”
“Is it because of bad conduct?”

original: Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe…🔽tena hi viññatti sīlanti.
analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  tena hi viññatti sīlanti
translated: “No.”🔽“Well then, is it because of intimation?”
The Discussion of “Is it because of intimation?” is finished.
